ygData.subject: Re: Homophobia
ygData.msgSnippet: he thinks it is hilarious the way some guys fall all over themselves to help a damsel in distress .  Also, I don t think his wife believes he has a problem,
ygData.messageBody:
he thinks it is hilarious the way some guys fall all over themselves to help
a 'damsel in distress'. Also, I don't think his wife believes he has a
problem, she is usually on with him enjoying the fun. I don't think you
should take these thing too seriously, this is after all, just a game.

-----Original Message-----
From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 20, 1999 8:04 AM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Homophobia


From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>


Now your friend...he has a problem. He likes flirting with men because of
the attention and gifts he gets?



-----Original Message-----
From: Obergfell, Steven <SObergfell@...>
To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com' <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 7:50 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Homophobia


>From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
>
>I have a friend how always chooses female characters in whatever video game
>he plays. He has 2 reasons:
>
>1) He'd rather look at a woman on the screen then a man.
>
>2) In On-Line games, he finds that he gets treated better by male players,
>especially if he is a little flirtatious. This includes guys just giving
>him money, magic, whatever. He did this on UO, he hasn't tried EQ yet.
>
>Lef Grebo of Halas
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Sean.Clark@... [mailto:Sean.Clark@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 3:16 PM
>To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Homophobia
>
>
>From: Sean.Clark@...
>
>Just guessing, but I'd say if it didn't make a difference to YOU, ya
>wouldn't have posted it in the first place!
>:-)
>Actually I have a friend who I've played Dungeons and Dragons and other
>roleplaying games on and off with for over 15 years, and he likes to play
>female characters. I've always thought it kinda weird myself, but he's
>certainly NOT gay.
>Sorry if I pissed ya off, was just givin ya a hard time...
>don;t get your panties all in a bunch!
>;-)
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Jason Coan [mailto:COANJ@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 3:54 PM
>To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Homophobia
>
>
>From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
>as I said in my origional post....WHY do guys play girls? and did I say it
>made a difference to me? no I didn't, read carefully.....just stated that
I
>think its weird and that I don't understand why guys play girls!!!!!!!!
>
>>>> <Sean.Clark@...> 5.19.99 4:37:40 PM >>>
>From: Sean.Clark@...
>
>You ARE a homophobe!
>Unless you're planning on having a relationship with an EQ avatar what's
the
>difference to you????
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Jason Coan [mailto:COANJ@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 3:00 PM
>To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Good to see...good to see
>
>
>From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
>Speaking of women.....There is one big question I have.....why do guys play
>girl characters....some say they are role playing.....do they also dress up
>in womens close and role play women in real life? or is "role playing" a
>female the first step towards role playing a real life female? I know there
>are a lot of legitimate female players, but I'd bet a large sum of money
>that most of the female characters are being driven by guys.....call me
>homophobic if you will, but I think its weird.
>
>>>> <suzkim@...> 5.19.99 12:47:10 PM >>>
>From: suzkim@...
>
>Hail,
>
>It was good to see another of the female gender with a passion for
>slashin an bashing!
>Currently on a mission to get my four bubbles for dual attack and dual
>weild *snickers*.
>
>*grumbles*
>gotta take care of some RL stuff so I can hunt.. hunt..hunt
>
>Azlana, Barbarian Warrior of Veeshan
>
>
